item.title: Preventing Insecure Network Connections | Apple Developer Documentation
item.description: On Apple platforms, a networking security feature called App Transport Security (ATS) improves privacy and data integrity for all apps and app extensions. It does this by requiring that network connections made by your app are secured by the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol using reliable certificates and ciphers. ATS blocks connections that don’t meet minimum security requirements.

item.title: What is the Value of Browser Diversity?
item.description: In May 2019 I attended a talk by Mike Taylor who works on webcompat at Mozilla. Mike told the sordid story of window.event, a non-standard IE invention that was replicated in Konqueror, which showed up in Webkit, which stuck around in Blink, and was now Mike’s problem in Firefox. It was a good story fraught with ups and downs and literal “Breaking the Web” level changes for a tiny feature rollout.

item.title: 10+ Sorts, Visualized - Disparity Cube (Radix, Gravity, Quicksort, ...)
item.description:
Visualization of 12 different Sorting Algorithms as a Cube with sound.
✅ Subscribe: https://www.youtube.com/CompilerStuck?sub_confirmation=1
Each dot, representing a part of the Cube has its own color. If it is swapped with another dot, its size changes according to how far it is away from its original position. Large Ball = Org. Pos. , Small Ball = Pos far away
Time Stamps: 00:00 Merge Sort 00:33 Gravity (Bead) Sort 00:45 Radix Sort (Base 10) 01:00 Cycle Sort 01:15 Heap Sort 01:40 Selection Sort 01:55 Quick Sort (Dual Pivot) 02:15 Shell Sort 02:37 Quick Sort (Pivot Middle) 02:50 Double Selection Sort 03:02 Comb Sort 03:51 Counting Sort 04:05 Comparison Table
Measurements explained: As "Comparison" counts the comparison of a value from the Array with any other value. As "Segment" counts every sorted part of the array. "Real Time" corresponds to the measured time only used for the algorithm. As "Swap" counts the exchange between the indexes of two elements of the array. As "Write to the Main Array" counts the change of a value in the Array.
Please put your wished and questions in the comments. :)
item.author: (CompilerStuck)
